title: How to Make Butter Pecan Cookies

steps.headline: Beat the butter and sugar together in a large bowl with an electric mixer on medium speed.
steps.description: Be sure that it is well blended...about 2 minutes.

steps.headline: Combine the flour and the salt and add it to the butter mixture.
Add the toasted pecans and mix again.
Divide the dough into four equal pieces and refrigerate for an hour.
Shape the dough into four logs and continue refrigerating for at least two hours.
steps.description: The dough can be frozen at this point for up to two months.

steps.headline: Line 2 baking pans, or cookie sheets, with parchment paper and set it to the side.
Slice the cookie rolls on an angle in ⁄4 inch (0.6 cm) slices.
Set the slices on the prepared pans about an inch apart.
Bake in the oven for 15 minutes.
steps.description: The cookies should be golden brown.

steps.headline: Store in an airtight container for up to a week.

text: Beat the butter and sugar together in a large bowl with an electric mixer on medium speed. Be sure that it is well blended...about 2 minutes. Add vanilla.  Combine the flour and the salt and add it to the butter mixture.  Continue mixing until thoroughly combined.  Add the toasted pecans and mix again.  Divide the dough into four equal pieces and refrigerate for an hour.  Shape the dough into four logs and continue refrigerating for at least two hours. The dough can be frozen at this point for up to two months. Heat oven to 350 °F (177 °C).  Line 2 baking pans, or cookie sheets, with parchment paper and set it to the side.  Slice the cookie rolls on an angle in ⁄4 inch (0.6 cm) slices.  Set the slices on the prepared pans about an inch apart.  Bake in the oven for 15 minutes. The cookies should be golden brown. Cool on a wire rack.  Store in an airtight container for up to a week.
